reviews.text: The staff here were really friendly and were very helpful. They told us were to go and where not to go. The rooms are clean and a good size. Our room contained two large cupboards, a microwave and a 'fridge. The property is old and is not your modern day fancy hotel - but this adds to the charm. check out the old fashioned elevators!
reviews.title: A great, friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is centrally located and within walking distance of most things. The breakfast is a simple buffet and quite basic - but fine.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were to stay in San Francisco I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: The worst hotel experience of my life!

reviews.text: The first week, we stayed at The Fairmont but, because of a major convention, we had to leave there and went to The Mayflower. Our room at The Mayflower was half the price of The Fairmont with many extras, including a garage for the car. We had free wireless ($14.95 a day at The Fairmont) and free continental breakfast ($33 for breakfast at The Fairmont). Quaint atmosphere and felt more like "old San Francisco", but very clean and neat. We will go back for another night before returning to China.
reviews.title: Very good deal and very friendly! Going back there!!

likes.disliked: — The only problem was the garage, but this is an old hotel for old cars

reviews.text: The Mayflower is an excellent find for those on a budget. I paid approx £40.00 a night for my room and it was more than adequate. The room was very big and plenty of storage of space. Shower was powerful and water always hot. Mattress was comfotable and room was very clean. Staff always pleasant and very helpful at check-in.
reviews.title: Great find for budget conscious travellers.

reviews.text: If you are going to pick fault with it then I guess you could say it is in need of renovation. The buffets in the rooms are very old and do look a little tatty. The danger of renovating though is the price increase it would bring. Also the windows are originals, hence the noise from the street, which can become a disturbance.
reviews.title: It had it's ups and downs

reviews.text: Free internet access is also a big PLUS. Always helpful to have this facility, especially when trying to make travel arrangements with other people you are trying to meet up with. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Price, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing I will say is that the Lillies in reception are far too overpowering and would be nice if they were replaced with something else.
reviews.title: Good hotel, lots of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for three nights in June with my boyfriend. Thought location was great..few minutes walk from Union Sq. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and modern.. had a huge walk in waldrobe-great to throw your luggage into and not have things everywhere! The room was similar to ant decent hotel room and had a microwave,fridge,cutlery,etc. Great for travellers who cannot afford to eat out constantly.. esp on the expensive West Coast. Good car parking rates availalbe..another rariity in SF. Would highly recommend staying here. Lovely Irish staff also! Hotel also very secure.
reviews.title: great hotel lovely staff
Great hotel in San Francisco
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel. Great location, close to Union Square. Free internet and free breakfast - couldn't ask for more. Rooms spacious and well fitted - everything you need. Everyone really helpful and always happy to help. A bargain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Mayflower for 5 nights, including New Years. We had a wonderful and wouldn't have picked another hotel. A little background: my husband and have lived in big cities including Atlanta, Chicago and San Francisco. My husband lived in the Russian Hill area of San Francisco for over 2 years just a few years ago.
reviews.title: Very happy at the Mayflower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the review: the hotel was very clean, including our room. When we checked in we were given a tour by the owner's (Nancy) husband. He showed all us all the different rooms, and gave us a choice of what room we wanted. It is a good idea to do this as all the rooms are bit different and you may find one you like more than another. For example, some rooms have newer refrigerators than others, different cabinetry, etc. They are in the (slow) process of remodeling the wet bar in each room and when they are all done they will look great! Currently, most of them are quite old, but still in good condition. We really enjoyed having a mini fridge and microwave in our room and was one of the many reasons we chose the Mayflower.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.text: We also picked a room on a higher floor, as the first and second floors are more open to street noise and are also colder. Since we went in the winter, we wanted to be warmer without using the heat (to avoid stuffiness). We kept the window open most of our stay and the noise was negligible. My husband sleeps with earplugs and is an extremely light sleeper and we both slept well. The bathroom fixtures are new, with old and neat bones still in place. The entire hotel is like this really, with the lovely features that old buildings have still in place, but modernized.
reviews.title: Good If on a budget, average for everything else.

likes.disliked: — Some things not so clean, a bit expensive for what you get.

reviews.text: Myself and my 2 friends stayed at The Mayflower for 3 nights in July and we were most impressed! The staff were all very friendly and when we arrived they gave us a map and told us where we should head to in the city and where the nearest bus/cable stops were - they even gave us a bottle of wine from the nearby Napa Valley to take to our room! The rooms were a good size, the beds were very comfortable and although there wasn't air con there was a large ceiling fan which was more than adequate... our room had a small kitchenette with a fridge and microwave and 2 very large walk in cupboards. Breakfast was basic but more than fine for the rate we paid. Location-wise this hotel is perfect, it is in a safe area and within walking distance to all the attractions in San Francisco. This is an old building but that adds to the charm! The lift in the reception area is particularly dinky! Oh and an added bonus was the computer area with free internet access.
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — Welcoming and friendly atmosphere, internet access, comfortable room

reviews.text: I was visiting San Francisco for 3 days, primarily to see my son and go to a game at AT&T Park (the Diamondbacks won! yay!). His studio apartment wouldn't quite work for the two of us but I wanted to stay close. I couldn't get any closer as the Mayflower is literally the building next to his apartment building. This was a cool old building with a very nice lobby and loft/mezzanine. The staff made me feel right at home. This is an historic building that while serviceable was not what I would describe as renovated. It was clean and comfortable, though, and it would be a tragedy if this place was brought to its full potential and turned into a trendy boutique hotel that cost $300 a night. Some might find the street-facing rooms a little noisy. I would/will certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted

likes.disliked: — had to go a couple of blocks to find a morning paper

reviews.text: Chosen on Tripadviser recommendations. Excellent place and very friendly and helpful staff, especially Nancy. Even returned things we had left behind. Difficult to believe that the combination of location and price can be beaten. Great sandwiches next door.
reviews.title: Great value & nice staff

reviews.text: I didn't get off to a good start here, as my rental Chevy Impala wouldn't fit through their garage doors. But it all picked up after that.
reviews.title: Better than expected for the price

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, my room looked like it had been recently painted -- as did the corridors -- which is good in a building as old as this one. (The elevators are the kind that require you to open the door to get out.)
reviews.title: Nice Place
